AMH3402 - History of the South to 1865.name: AMH3402 - History of the South to 1865

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of the southern colonies, beginning sectionalism, the cotton economy, and slavery, Calhoun's constitutional theories, secession, Civil War and its aftermath.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of Black Americans from Africa, to slavery, to freedom and its limits in pre-World War I America.

AMH3403 - History of the South Since 186.name: AMH3403 - History of the South Since 1865

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Reconstruction, the "solid South" and the racial dilemma, progressivism for whites only, southern literature, 20th-century economic, political and social changes, and the new Reconstruction.

AMH3562 - Women in American History II.name: AMH3562 - Women in American History II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines industrialization, entry of women into higher education and professions, winning of suffrage, changing profile of female wage earner, and rise of modern feminist movement.

AMH3370 - Capitalism & Democracy in US H.name: AMH3370 - Capitalism & Democracy in US History

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to the economic development of the U.S., with emphasis on agriculture, labor, industrialization, transportation, and banking.

AMH3560 - Women, Law, and Society in Ame.name: AMH3560 - Women, Law, and Society in American History

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the intersection of women and law in American History from the Colonial era to the present.

AMH3541 - U. S. Military History To 1900.name: AMH3541 - U. S. Military History To 1900

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: U.S. military history from the colonial period to 1900 focusing on the creation of American military institutions, conduct of war, and influence on society.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: AMH 2010 and AMH 2020, or EUH 2000 and EUH 2001.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The social, political, and economic significance of the law as a historic process in America.

AMH3561 - Women in American History I.name: AMH3561 - Women in American History I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines women in indigenous, colonial, African-American slave and free societies, Republican Motherhood, impact of industrialization on women's roles, and emergence of women's rights movement.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Survey of U.S. History from 1492-1877.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Enhances understanding of Indian peoples living in the vicinity of present-day Florida from the pre-colonial period to the present.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of Florida from post-war industrialization to the present.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: U. S. military history since 1900 emphasizing civil-military relations, warfare, and military developments.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Permission of Honors and AMH 2010 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Survey of U.S. History from 1877 to the present. May be taken before AMH 2010. Honors-level content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of Florida from U.S. territory until post-war industrialization.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Survey of U.S. History from 1877 to the present. May be taken before AMH 2010.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Survey of U.S. History from 1492-1877.

AMH3442 - History of the Frontier: Weste.name: AMH3442 - History of the Frontier: Western America

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The development of the trans-Mississippi West and its impact upon American history.

AMH1070 - Florida: People, Places, and H.name: AMH1070 - Florida: People, Places, and History

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to Florida, focusing on the state's History and its place in the world.

AMH3441 - History of the Frontier: Easte.name: AMH3441 - History of the Frontier: Eastern America

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The progression of the westward movement from the colonial settlements to the Mississippi, considered as an interpretive approach to American history.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The risk of American nationalism, Jacksonian Democracy, the Mexican War, and sectional conflict.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Canada since Colonial times and the present, but with emphasis on the period since the British North America Act, 1867.

AMH3586 - History of Latinos in the U.S..name: AMH3586 - History of Latinos in the U.S.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Course begins with 16th century through the modern period. Special emphasis on Chicanos, Puerto Ricans, and Cubans.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: American sport emphasizing the development of professional and collegiate sport since 1945.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A history of Black America in the Twentieth Century and the continuing struggle for equality in America.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An interdisciplinary examination of American history and the emergence of car culture from the late nineteenth-century.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The European Backgrounds: Puritanism; Enlightenment; the Great Awakening; Revolutionary Thought: Romanticism; the Southern Mind and the Yankee Response; Popular Culture and the rise of recreation.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: World War II, the Cold War and America in the fifties.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The voyages of discovery, the origins of the thirteen colonies, and their political, economic, social, and religious life in the 17th and 18th centuries.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Confederation era, the Federalists, Jeffersonian Democracy, and the War of 1812.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Civil rights and Women's Liberation Movements, Vietnam War, Watergate, the decline of liberalism and the rise of conservatism, end of the Cold War.

AMH4201 - The Gilded Age and Progressivi.name: AMH4201 - The Gilded Age and Progressivism

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Rise of Industrialized and Urbanized America, The emergence of the New South and the New West, the Populist Movement, overseas expansion, Progressivism.

AMH4130 - The Age of the American Revolu.name: AMH4130 - The Age of the American Revolution, 1763-1789

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The American Revolution - its origins, course, and impact upon American society - the Articles of Confederation, the Philadelphia Convention and its work.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of North American Indians and their relations with the United States from the 18th century to the present.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The progressive reforms of Woodrow Wilson, World War I, post-war prosperity, the Depression, the New Deal, and the coming of World War II.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Reconstruction, and impact of industrialism.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The impact and transforming effect of the Atlantic System on the peoples of Western Europe, Western Africa, the Caribbean and the Americas.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the history of technology in the United States, its impact on society, and society's impact on technological development.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of 'C' (2.0) or better in ENC 1102 or AMH 2020, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Historical relationship between tourism and the United States as both tourist site and exporter of tourists, through primary sources.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Post World War II US rocketry and space travel with focus on the role of Cape Canaveral/Kennedy Space Center.

AMH4513 - US Foreign Relations: Close of.name: AMH4513 - US Foreign Relations: Close of World War II to the Present

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: U.S. foreign relations from the end of World War II to the present day.

AMH4512 - US Foreign Relations from the.name: AMH4512 - US Foreign Relations from the Founding Era to World War II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: U.S. foreign relations from the Founding era to the end of World War II, with focus on the two world wars.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines how American society uses Western ideas about sex and gender to define women's roles in science and their influence on their fields.

AMH4644 - Viewing American History in th.name: AMH4644 - Viewing American History in the Twentieth Century

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of television, film, comics, and other popular media as primary sources in the study of U.S. History in the 20th Century.

AMH4594H - Honors Laser Scanning America.name: AMH4594H - Honors Laser Scanning America's Past

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Recording a structure's "life history," combining laser scans and digital data with photographs, documents, and oral histories of individuals associated with the building. With honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Aviation development in the United States and its role in American culture.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of 'C' (2.0) or better in ENC 1102 or AMH 2020, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The recording of a structure's "life history," combining laser scans and digital data with photographs, documents, and oral histories of individuals associated with the building.

AMH4575 - History of the Civil Rights Mo.name: AMH4575 - History of the Civil Rights Movement

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or AMH 2020, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of the African-American Civil Rights Movement from 19th century origins to 1960s victories to today, through analysis of social and cultural primary sources.

AMH4510 - Rise of the United States to W.name: AMH4510 - Rise of the United States to World Power, 1776-1914

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The evolution of basic American policies. American expansion. America's major wars, and the emergence of America as a world power.

AMH4573 - Black Militancy in the 20th Ce.name: AMH4573 - Black Militancy in the 20th Century

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The rise and development of black militant organizations and how these groups have been influenced by hostile foreign entities.
